com.ibm.db2.r2dbc

Class DB2Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.db2.r2dbc.DB2Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.r2dbc.spi.Closeable, io.r2dbc.spi.Connection

    public class DB2Connection
extends Object
implements io.r2dbc.spi.Connection
    DB2Connection represents the connection to the DB2 database server. A connection can be obtained from a connection factory or from a connection pool.

    Example:

    
    // Build configuration definition
    DB2ConnectionConfiguration config = DB2ConnectionConfiguration.builder()
                                            .database("DB2DSN")
                                            .host("rs28")
                                            .port(1234)
                                            .username("TS1234")
                                            .password("****")
                                            .conPoolSize(25)   // max connections
                                            .stmtCacheSize(10) // max statements to cache
                                            .build();

    // Create connection factory
    DB2ConnectionFactory factory = new DB2ConnectionFactory(config);
    
    // Get a connection
    Mono<DB2Connection> con = factory.create();
    
    // Create a connection pool
    DB2ConnectionPool cp = new DB2ConnectionPool(factory);

    // Get a pooled connection. 
    Mono<DB2Connection> pcon = cp.getConnection();

      • beginTransaction

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Void> beginTransaction()
        Begins a transaction. This turns off the auto-commit flag. This transaction has to be explicitly committed using commitTransaction() or rolled back using rollbackTransaction()
        Specified by:
        beginTransaction in interface io.r2dbc.spi.Connection
        See Also:
        commitTransaction(), rollbackTransaction()

      • commitTransaction

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Void> commitTransaction()
        Commits the current transaction started using the beginTransaction(). Then sets the auto-commit flag to true. Any SQL statements executed outside the begin-commit/rollback boundary will be auto committed.
        Specified by:
        commitTransaction in interface io.r2dbc.spi.Connection
        See Also:
        beginTransaction()
